result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan E Tillman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography by Person Under Age of 18, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must have no unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18.
Must maintain absolute sobriety and remain drug free.

Must comply with psychosexual evaluation and any therapy recommended.
Must register as a sex offender.
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Must complete any other evaluations or counseling recommended by Probation Agent.

timeConds.notes: Huber granted for all purposes including work search.

Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Concurrent with: 15CF170

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are reduced to judgment.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

Defendant Jonathan E Tillman in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Jonathan E Tillman in custody.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CF84 & 15CF170

Argument by State. Argument by Defense. Defendant addresses the Court. Court relates and orders:

Count 2 , 4 and 6:  9 months jail on each count concurrent with each other with credit for 315 days served.

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.  
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

2 years extended supervision:

Defendant Jonathan E Tillman in court with attorney Matthew Krische.  Defendant Jonathan E Tillman in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF84 - Count 1
15CF170 - Counts 2, 4 & 6
Jail credit agreement - 158 days.
No additions or corrections to PSI by State or Defense.
State files victim impact statement and C-31.
Defense has no objection to restitution being requested.

Argument by State.
Argument by Attorney Krische.

Court relates regarding sex offender registration.
Court finds defendant must register as a sex offender.

Defendant addresses Court.

Court relates and orders on 15CF84:
SW - 3 years probation.
45 days jail with huber for all purposes including work search.
Comply with psycho sexual evaluation and comply with any therapy recommended.
Register as a sex offender.
No unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18.
Maintain absolute sobriety and remain drug free.
Pay restitution.
DNA sample and surcharge.
Any other evaluations or counseling recommended by probation.
Court costs.
Court finds he does not have to pay child pornography surcharge of $500.00 as he was not 18 years of age.

15CF170 - Counts 2, 4 & 6
SW - 2 years probation concurrent with 15CF84.
Count 2 - Restitution per C-31.
Beginning in 11-01-2015 defendant is ordered to make monthly payments of $75.00 until restitution is paid in full.
Comply with any treatment recommendations as set forth by probation agent.
Court costs.
DNA sample ordered.
158 days jail credit if revoked.  

Voter Rights form and Order to Submit DNA Specimen form given to defendant.
Felony firearm admonition given to defendant.

Defendant Jonathan E Tillman in court with attorney Matthew James Krische.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts Defendant's waiver, finds probable cause and binds over for trial. State files Information. Defendant waives formal reading and pleads NG. Defense makes bond modification request. Court grants modification to bond as follows: Defendant can utilize the internet for school purposes only while supervised by school staff. All other conditions remain in full force and effect.
